1.caption: Millions of tonnes of clothing, shoes and other textiles end up in landfill every year because very little is sent for recycling

2.caption: Sorting clothing by hand is a time consuming task made more complicated by the many blends of man-made and natural fibres used in modern garments

3.caption: Treating cotton-polyester blends with enzymes from fungi can recover the man-made fibres for reuse

4.caption: The dye that is added to clothing also needs to be removed before it the yarn can be recycled

5.caption: The shredding process used by mechanical recycling methods leads to shorter, weaker fibres that cannot be resued to make clothes
